intro: Nicotiana pallescens, commonly known as the pale tobacco plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. Its leaves are broad and hairy, and it is often found in rocky or arid environments. Nicotiana pallescens is also noted for its potential use in phytochemical research due to its biochemical composition.
